title: OpenSSL with -DOPENSSL_NO_SRTP errors when initializing backend
body:
When building OpenSSL with the -DOPENSSL_NO_SRTP flag, pyca/cryptography fails to initialize the default backend.

I built OpenSSL against OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable commit (a9a8863b7), with the following config:

```
./config --prefix=/home/ubuntu/openssl/build --openssldir=/home/ubuntu/openssl/build -DOPENSSL_NO_SRTP
make clean; make
make install
```

Then I get the following error:

```
(venv) ubuntu@ip-172-31-21-1:~/openssl/openssl$ python
Python 3.6.9 (default, Nov  7 2019, 10:44:02) 
[GCC 8.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from cryptography.hazmat.backends import default_backend
>>> default_backend()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/ubuntu/openssl/cryptography/src/cryptography/hazmat/backends/__init__.py", line 15, in default_backend
    from cryptography.hazmat.backends.openssl.backend import backend
  File "/home/ubuntu/openssl/cryptography/src/cryptography/hazmat/backends/openssl/__init__.py", line 7, in <module>
    from cryptography.hazmat.backends.openssl.backend import backend
  File "/home/ubuntu/openssl/cryptography/src/cryptography/hazmat/backends/openssl/backend.py", line 75, in <module>
    from cryptography.hazmat.bindings.openssl import binding
  File "/home/ubuntu/openssl/cryptography/src/cryptography/hazmat/bindings/openssl/binding.py", line 16, in <module>
    from cryptography.hazmat.bindings._openssl import ffi, lib
ImportError: /home/ubuntu/openssl/cryptography/src/cryptography/hazmat/bindings/_openssl.abi3.so: symbol SSL_CTX_set_tlsext_use_srtp version OPENSSL_1_1_0 not defined in file libssl.so.1.1 with link time reference
```
I'm running against head of cryptography (commit c0dbbb52). 

Using the same setup, and removing the `-DOPENSSL_NO_SRTP` flag to `config` I'm able to initialize the backend as expected.

Os
```
$ uname -a
Linux ip-172-31-21-1 4.15.0-1058-aws #60-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jan 15 22:35:20 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Python version:
```
$ python --version
Python 3.6.9
```

According this link [1], there are a few things that can be disabled in OpenSSL, and if you'll accept this as a bug, I'd be happy to create some script that goes through all the permutations of flags to find out what breaks when this project tries to use it.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7827836/build-openssl-with-just-rsa-and-aes#7828924
